detailed_info.name: Perfume
detailed_info.description: Unfortunately, the term “fragrance” conceals numerous odorant molecules that are potentially irritating or even allergenic. It's hard to know what to do when you're allergic to a product and the information isn't very detailed. Nevertheless, to help us, Europe has regulated 24 molecules (more than 80 from 2026) which, when used above a certain concentration, must be mentioned in the INCI list (generally at the end), even though they are themselves part of a product's fragrance. This is the case, for example, with Limonene, linalool...

functions.name: Masking
functions.description: Reduces or inhibits the odor or basic taste of the product

functions.name: Perfuming
functions.description: Used for perfume and aromatic raw materials
